channel.title: Why I use moparscape again, and why YOU should
channel.description:
MOTIVATORS Posted the same thread on mopar and my site, and you guys were actually intellgent and helped along with me :), send me more failed topics from other sites :D http://www.rune -server.org/runescape-development/rs2-server/projects/231439-zerocomfor-317-golden-era-reproduction.html
I actually respect moparscape nowadays more, because i can see improvements coming in. The site is clean and basic, plus it doesn't have alot of flaming issues. HOWEVER, there are still problems, and we all know that.
This vote gives you a choice of forums that you don't think are active enough, has flaming problems, and the members don't get banned enough.
I'd say that you should vote for r-s Reasons for my opnion: I just joined the r-s site, and I found all the flaming from here x100. I decided to post this topic NOT out of anger, but i want to see your opinions. Plz sho meh urz opinions

item.title: Why I use moparscape again, and why YOU should
item.dc:creator: @Natey Natey
item.description:
@Natey wrote:

[quote=“The Soul, post:29, topic:340771”]The only problem with this forum is that we (generically speaking) don’t try. If you take a look at the help section, there are a good amount of people that want everything done for them on a silver platter; when they don’t get it, they tend to bitch. Obviously I don’t support spoonfeeding in anyway and encourage users to be independent but sometimes it isn’t enough.[/quote]yes.

Read full topic
item.source: Why I use moparscape again, and why YOU should

item.title: Why I use moparscape again, and why YOU should
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

New server owners go to Moparscape, have a look at the Server Downloads board and ask for help in the Server Help board. They won’t get any and begin to cry before leaving for other communities. This is the part when they do not care about Moparscape When they get advanced in programming servers, they stay on the community they are on.

Read full topic
item.source: Why I use moparscape again, and why YOU should

item.title: Why I use moparscape again, and why YOU should
item.dc:creator: @Javafire Javafire
item.description:
@Javafire wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:23, topic:340771”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=437152.msg3212873#msg3212873 date=1274415865]
WRONG!

Server emulation started on Kaitnieks. [/quote]
This I already knew, woman! I didn’t expect someone such as you to intervene in my elaboration though, else I would have mentioned it’s existence.[/quote]
hopefully ^^^

Read full topic
item.source: Why I use moparscape again, and why YOU should

item.title: Why I use moparscape again, and why YOU should
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Jc22493, post:27, topic:340771”][quote author=(Anthony) link=topic=437152.msg3213293#msg3213293 date=1274476637]

Rune-Serv is filled with followers of Graham and Blake. I can’t make complete judgment on the community, as I’ve only been there a few times, but at a quick glance I’ve seen enough to make that assessment. The “coders” there are more dedicated than we are. They actually take the time to look into things and strive to achieve something. We’re still stuck on changing features while they’re making them better.

No, they sit there guessing at shit for hours having no clue what they are doing and when they finally get it, it’s like some kind of fucking miracle. That’s how it works at rune- server.
[/quote]At least they’re guessing for answers. We’re only watching them guess for answers.

You don’t gain any knowledge by guessing.

If I guess and get it right, I’ve gained knowledge from the right guess. :P[/quote]

Exactly, that’s how the light-bulb was invented. When he had finally found the correct metal to use, after roughly a thousand tries (at least thats what I was told in History class back in High-School). When he was asked, if he thinks all of those other attempts were a waste, he simply said, no, he learned a thousand ways NOT to make a lightbulb.

Simplify: Guessing can lead to some great things in life. I just used the lightbulb as an example.

Read full topic
item.source: Why I use moparscape again, and why YOU should

item.title: Why I use moparscape again, and why YOU should
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

The only problem with this forum is that we (generically speaking) don’t try. If you take a look at the help section, there are a good amount of people that want everything done for them on a silver platter; when they don’t get it, they tend to bitch. Obviously I don’t support spoonfeeding in anyway and encourage users to be independent but sometimes it isn’t enough.

Read full topic
item.source: Why I use moparscape again, and why YOU should

item.title: Why I use moparscape again, and why YOU should
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:14, topic:340771”]I agree with Prima 100%. I have released some things (back when customs were the popular thing) to expand your Class8 to allow more items than it would typically hold. On here, it was treated with at least some respect. On R-S, I got shot down as if i was a piece of shit.

My Vote: R-S is the worst -.-[/quote]

Most likely you created a sub of class8, to extend it, which is common sense.

I could be wrong -.-

[quote=“Frell, post:16, topic:340771”][quote author=pure2ownage link=topic=437152.msg3212289#msg3212289 date=1274375384]
i went on rune -server to release something and got a bunch of flame.
i quit.
rune -server < MoparScape.
Btw its sad that they have better programmers then us, compared to them we have less.
maybe Graham, Prima and Pali.
[/quote]
Palidino took code from winterlove to make it compatible with the new clients, anyone over at mitb could have done this. But everyone wanted to avoid using the winterlove server again because it was shit. Hes not that great.[/quote]

He is a good programmer, but he just does sloppy things, if you take a look at battlescape, it was coded pretty bad…

But his new base, with new combat is pretty sweet, and he also knows how a 317 client is, since he was the first with 562 everything on a 317.

[quote="(Anthony), post:24, topic:340771"][quote author=The Reaper X link=topic=437152.msg3212859#msg3212859 date=1274412095]
Rune-Serv is filled with followers of Graham and Blake. I can’t make complete judgment on the community, as I’ve only been there a few times, but at a quick glance I’ve seen enough to make that assessment. The “coders” there are more dedicated than we are. They actually take the time to look into things and strive to achieve something. We’re still stuck on changing features while they’re making them better.
[/quote]
No, they sit there guessing at shit for hours having no clue what they are doing and when they finally get it, it’s like some kind of fucking miracle. That’s how it works at rune- server.[/quote]

Your assessment is an opinion. Nothing is being done at moparscape, we are talking about moparscape, not moparisthebest. That is fact.

Read full topic
item.source: Why I use moparscape again, and why YOU should

item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

WRONG!

Server emulation started on Kaitnieks. then moved to moparisthebest.com Somewhere around here phate started google a winterlove server that had a control panel and loading and saving from a sql database. after awhile moparisthebest got sick of the server crowd and banished them to moparisthebest.com. and that fag kevin took over rs.

Read full topic
item.source: Why I use moparscape again, and why YOU should

item.title: Why I use moparscape again, and why YOU should
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

Moparscape is the origin or mother of private servers. It’s inevitable that we’re going to be the most developed.

Rune-Serv is filled with followers of Graham and Blake. I can’t make complete judgment on the community, as I’ve only been there a few times, but at a quick glance I’ve seen enough to make that assessment. The “coders” there are more dedicated than we are. They actually take the time to look into things and strive to achieve something. We’re still stuck on changing features while they’re making them better.

Locus is probably the most diverse. Not community wise, but as a site. They’ve established more features than any RSPS community I’ve been to.

Frugoo is a family forum imo. I’ve spent a long time there in the past, and there’s nothing bad about that. When I was there, there wasn’t as much crybaby ass shit as there is here right now. There are a lot of idiots over there, but they’re still a family. We couldn’t hold ourselves together if the forum was at stake; hence our present situation.

Read full topic
item.source: Why I use moparscape again, and why YOU should

item.title: Why I use moparscape again, and why YOU should
item.dc:creator: @Javafire Javafire
item.description:
@Javafire wrote:

[quote=“noobs are ftw, post:15, topic:340771”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=437152.msg3212570#msg3212570 date=1274392602]
I agree with Prima 100%. I have released some things (back when customs were the popular thing) to expand your Class8 to allow more items than it would typically hold. On here, it was treated with at least some respect. On R-S, I got shot down as if i was a piece of shit.

My Vote: R-S is the worst -.-
[/quote]

r-s my fav lol[/quote]
cuz they have some originals on there :P, everyone is entitled to an opinion

Read full topic
